learningObjectives.text: Create compelling visual process documentation and improvement recommendations

learningObjectives.text: Develop a communication strategy for implementing process changes across the organization

traceability.employerNeed: Implementation roadmap with prioritized action items
traceability.studentGoal: Learn to translate complex information for different audiences
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Manage project deliverables, timelines, and client relationships professionally

traceability.institutionalOutcome: Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders

learningObjectives.text: Reflect on professional growth and articulate competencies for communications and consulting careers

traceability.studentGoal: Build a portfolio of professional work
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Reflect critically on personal and professional development

objectives: Understand organizational context and communication needs

activities.description: Meet with Operations Manager for project kickoff
Review existing onboarding materials and communications
Reflect on organizational communication style and needs
Read: Process documentation and visual communication strategies
Draft project plan with communication milestones

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what did you learn about the organization's communication style? What materials did you review?
dealReflection.examine: How do corporate communications differ from media or PR contexts? What strategic principles apply?
dealReflection.articulate: Ben, what communication skills do you expect to apply? What new skills might this project develop?

activities.description: Shadow onboarding activities and document observations
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: share observations
Read: Visual process mapping and infographic design
Create initial visual process map drafts

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what did you observe about the current process? How did you approach visual documentation?
dealReflection.examine: How do visual communication principles apply to process documentation? What makes a process map clear and useful?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating observations into visual formats? How does this build your portfolio skills?

activities.description: Design interview questions and approach
Conduct pilot interview and gather feedback
Read: Professional interviewing techniques for research
Begin conducting stakeholder interviews

dealReflection.describe: How did you design your interview approach? What techniques are you using?
dealReflection.examine: How do your interview skills from journalism coursework apply here? What's different about organizational research?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional interviewing? How does this strengthen your communication skills?

activities.description: Complete remaining stakeholder interviews
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss findings
Read: Thematic analysis and storytelling with data
Finalize process map and begin theme analysis

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what stories are emerging from your interviews? What visual approaches worked best?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance individual stories with systematic analysis? What narrative techniques help communicate findings?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about combining visual and narrative communication? How does this add to your professional toolkit?

activities.description: Analyze and code interview data for themes
Share emerging narrative with mentor
Read: Organizational storytelling and change communication
Develop narrative framework and supporting visuals

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what themes emerged? How did you develop the narrative around your findings?
dealReflection.examine: How do you create compelling stories from organizational data? What makes findings memorable and actionable?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about organizational storytelling? How might this skill apply in corporate communications roles?

activities.description: Design and write stakeholder interview summary
Present findings to Operations Manager
Read: Client presentation and feedback integration
Incorporate feedback and plan recommendations phase

dealReflection.describe: How did you present your findings? What visual and narrative elements were most effective?
dealReflection.examine: How do you adapt your communication style for different professional audiences? What feedback strategies help improve your work?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about client communication and feedback? How has your professional confidence grown?

weeks.theme: Best Practices Research and Content Development

activities.description: Research client onboarding best practices
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss research approach
Read: Content strategy and recommendation communication
Begin creating visual recommendation content

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what best practices did you discover? How are you presenting them visually?
dealReflection.examine: How do you make research findings engaging and actionable? What content strategies are most effective?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about research-based content creation? How does this strengthen your portfolio?

activities.description: Develop recommendations with visual support
Review recommendations with mentor
Read: Change communication and visual persuasion
Refine visual recommendations based on feedback

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what recommendations did you develop? How did you use visual design to support them?
dealReflection.examine: How do visuals enhance persuasion and understanding? What design principles are most effective?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about visual communication for recommendations? How does this expand your professional capabilities?

activities.description: Create prioritized implementation roadmap
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: review communication approach
Read: Change management communication strategies
Develop change communication plan and materials

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure the implementation roadmap? What communication materials did you create?
dealReflection.examine: How does strategic communication support organizational change? What role does timing play?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about change communication? How might this skill apply in corporate communications careers?

activities.description: Finalize comprehensive recommendations document
Quality review with mentor
Read: Professional document production standards
Polish design and create appendices

dealReflection.describe: How did you approach the final document design? What quality standards did you apply?
dealReflection.examine: What distinguishes professional-quality deliverables? How do you ensure consistency and polish?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional document production? How does this strengthen your portfolio?

activities.description: Design executive presentation with visual storytelling
Practice presentation and receive feedback
Read: Executive presentation and visual storytelling
Refine presentation and prepare talking points

dealReflection.describe: How did you design your presentation for maximum impact? What storytelling techniques did you use?
dealReflection.examine: How do you create presentations that drive action? What balance of visual and verbal communication works best?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about executive presentations? How has this prepared you for professional communication roles?

activities.description: Deliver final presentation to leadership
Debrief with mentor on project experience
Read: Portfolio development and career positioning
Complete portfolio pieces and final reflection

dealReflection.describe: How did your final presentation go? What was the response to your recommendations?
dealReflection.examine: Looking back at the project, how did your communication skills evolve? What moments were most challenging and rewarding?
dealReflection.articulate: What are the key portfolio pieces from this project? How has this experience shaped your career direction in communications?

assessment.overview: Assessment emphasizes communication and visual design competencies through professional deliverables, a culminating presentation showcasing executive communication, reflective practice, and employer evaluation.

deliverables.description: Tangible artifacts demonstrating communication and visual design competency, creating portfolio-ready professional work.

descriptors.exemplary: Process visualization is exceptionally clear and innovative; complex workflow immediately understandable through masterful visual design
descriptors.proficient: Process is clearly communicated visually; design choices support understanding
descriptors.developing: Process is visualized but could be clearer; some design choices confuse rather than clarify
descriptors.beginning: Visual communication is poor; process difficult to understand from the visualization

descriptors.exemplary: Demonstrates exceptional design skills; typography, color, layout, and visual hierarchy work together beautifully; portfolio showcase quality
descriptors.proficient: Design is professional and polished; good use of design principles
descriptors.developing: Design is adequate but lacks polish; inconsistencies in visual treatment
descriptors.beginning: Design is unprofessional or distracting; poor use of design principles

descriptors.exemplary: Process documented with exceptional accuracy; captures nuances and variations; validated thoroughly by stakeholders
descriptors.proficient: Process accurately represented; stakeholder validation confirms correctness
descriptors.developing: Generally accurate but some errors or omissions; limited validation
descriptors.beginning: Significant accuracy issues; process misrepresented or not validated

descriptors.exemplary: Comprehensively documents all process elements including roles, handoffs, decision points, and exceptions
descriptors.proficient: Documents all major process elements; complete picture of workflow
descriptors.developing: Most elements present but some gaps; incomplete documentation
descriptors.beginning: Missing major process elements; incomplete understanding evident

descriptors.exemplary: Demonstrates exceptional stakeholder engagement; multiple perspectives incorporated and validation process well-documented
descriptors.proficient: Good stakeholder engagement; validation process evident
descriptors.developing: Some stakeholder input but engagement could be deeper

descriptors.exemplary: Immediately portfolio-ready; demonstrates professional capabilities that would impress potential employers
descriptors.proficient: Could be included in portfolio with minor adjustments; shows professional competence
descriptors.developing: Would need significant revision before portfolio inclusion
descriptors.beginning: Not suitable for professional portfolio in current state

presentation.name: Executive Presentation
presentation.description: Communication is a core NACE competency. This culminating presentation demonstrates ability to engage executive audiences through compelling visual storytelling.

reflections.description: Reflections are the key mechanism for learning transfer, helping students connect communication practice to theory and articulate professional growth.
reflections.schedule: Weekly DEAL reflections submitted each Friday

employerEvaluation.description: Employer feedback validates communication and design skills from the practitioner perspective.

sampleWeek.subtitle: Synthesizing diverse perspectives into visual narrative
objectives: Complete all stakeholder interviews using professional techniques
Begin identifying themes and narrative opportunities

activities.description: Complete remaining stakeholder interviews (2-3 sessions)
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss findings and visual approach
Read: Thematic analysis and storytelling with organizational data

resources.title: How to Create Process Maps That Actually Get Used
resources.relevance: Practical guidance on creating visual process documentation that drives organizational action
resources.personalizationNote: Ben, this connects your visual design skills to creating process documentation that stakeholders will actually reference and use.

resources.title: Visual Thinking for Business Communication
resources.relevance: Techniques for translating complex information into clear visual formats
resources.personalizationNote: This builds on your Visual Communication coursework to help you create process maps that tell a compelling story.

resources.title: Visual Storytelling for Process Improvement
resources.relevance: Personalized framework connecting your communications training to process documentation
resources.personalizationNote: Created specifically for your project based on your coursework in Strategic Communication and Visual Communication
resources.content:
Your digital media and visual communication background gives you a unique advantage in this consulting project. Here's how to leverage those skills:

**Process as Story**
Think of the onboarding process as a user journey with a beginning, middle, and end. Each stakeholder's experience is a character arc within that journey. Your process map should reveal where the narrative breaks down-where confusion, frustration, or abandonment occur.

**Visual Hierarchy in Process Maps**
Not all steps are equally important. Use visual weight (size, color, position) to distinguish critical decision points from routine steps. Highlight the pain points your stakeholders identified using visual emphasis techniques.

**The Power of Before/After**
Your eventual recommendations will be more compelling if the current state documentation clearly shows what's broken. Design your visuals now with an eye toward the transformation story you'll tell later.

**Questions for Your Design**
- How can you show the emotional experience of the process, not just the steps?
- What visual metaphors might make abstract problems tangible (bottlenecks, loops, dead ends)?
- How can your process map serve both as documentation and as a persuasive tool for change?

activities.description: Finalize process map design and begin coding interviews for themes

dealReflection.describe: Ben, what stories are emerging from your interviews? What visual approaches worked best?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance individual stories with systematic analysis? What narrative techniques help communicate findings?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about combining visual and narrative communication? How does this add to your professional toolkit?

experientialCompetencies.addressedBy: Client-facing consulting work creating visual documentation and presentations for process improvement
Weekly DEAL reflections on communication effectiveness and visual storytelling approaches
Connections between Communications coursework (visual design, strategic messaging) and organizational change communication
Portfolio development showcasing professional consulting deliverables for future career opportunities
